page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY FERNDOWN
page.content: {Ferndown}got its name mainly from the heath,{Fern on the Down.}The{Post {Office}at Ferndown crossroads has changed considerably over the years. It started off as a Post Office and a village store, which sold many things such as coffee, cheese and spices. It sells only stationery now. In Victoria Road was a bungalow which had a plot of land beside it, (where Library Road was) but now the area has been converted into a car park connected with the new{Tesco.} The{village hall}has always been, and still is, used for many activities. In 1953 the Queen's Coronation was televised and most people watched it in the hall. The main London to Dorchester{railway line ran just north of Ferndown from 1847 to 1966. The nearest station is now in{Bournemouth.
